newsitem.title: USA: RLI Q1 net boosted by property underwriting.
newsitem.headline: RLI Q1 net boosted by property underwriting.

text.p: RLI Corp said Thursday it reported its sixth consecutive quarter of record earnings, again boosted primarily by property underwriting profits.
RLI posted first quarter profits of $6.56 million or $0.85 per primary share, versus $5.52 million or $0.70 a share last year. Revenues were $39.65 million, compared with $38.04 million.
"Property underwriting profits were once again the primary factor contributing to the record-setting performance," the company said.
Property underwriting pretax profits were $4.1 million for the quarter, up from $2.7 million last year.
RLI said its surety division posted its first quarterly operating profit.

"Surety's contribution coincides with our profitability expectations for this line of business," RLI president Gerald Stevens said in a statement. "Meeting this timetable renews our confidence in our ability to bring new growth opportunities on line."

Gross sales rose to $76.87 million versus $69.31 million last year, boosted by the company's entrance into the homeowners insurance market in Hawaii, RLI said. The assumption of business underwritten by the Hawaii Property Insurance Association accounted for $10.7 million in new gross written premiums for the quarter.
